const Portfolio_data = [{
  id: 1,
  category: "UI Design",
  title: "Iterative Redesign: Redesigning a startup's interface",
  image: "/images/portfolio-03.png",
  intro: "Building a new product requires an innate understanding of how users will understand your product, interact with your product and remember your product. Thus, this project aimed to task us to create an interface for a new startup, whose product we have never seen, and perform user-testing on our design to inform our design process.",
  methodology: "In order to begin this project, we had to find a new startup to design a product for. Using YCombinator's database, we discovered InTuned: a tool aimed to help software engineering managers track the progress of their team and customize what data they track. Without knowledge of how InTuned implemented their interface, we utilized Figma and Balsmic to create prototypes",
  goals: "The goals of this project were to a) understand what InTuned's key features were, b) Build low-fi and hi-fi interfaces to maximize InTuned's capabilities and c) Incorporate user feedback to drive our design process",
  skills: "User Experience Research, Figma, Prototyping",
  results: "We believe we designed an effective system to serve InTuned's purpose. We, actually, emailed the co-founders of InTuned and received great feedback!",
  caption: "Figure: The main dashboard of InTuned's redesigned interface"
}, {
  id: 2,
  category: "React Development",
  title: "Development: Using React to Build an E-Commerce site",
  image: "/images/portfolio-02.png",
  intro: "When building a new product, understanding how users understand and utilize a new interface is key to developing an effective product. In order to test our understanding of interface-design and user-experience, I (along with 3 other classmates) created our own version of a website for InTuned, a startup in the Y22 Combinator class, to test our own skills in understanding a product and it's key features and using UI/UX principles to build an effective product. In order to best understand our users, we performed multiple user tests with anonymous subjects",
